Entries.DialogueText: So, how was your first night in the old cottage?
Entries.DisplayPattern: So, how was your first night in the old cottage?

Entries.DialogueText: Your grandpa used to complain about the rickety old bed. But I think, deep down, he actually loved that house.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Your grandpa used to complain about the rickety old bed. But I think, deep down, he actually loved that house.

Entries.DialogueText: I've sampled many teas in my life, but none are quite so rare and special as this. Thanks!
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've sampled many teas in my life, but none are quite so rare and special as this. Thanks!

Entries.DialogueText: Ah, you remembered the old mayor's birthday. That's very thoughtful of you. And it's a nice gift! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ah, you remembered the old mayor's birthday. That's very thoughtful of you. And it's a nice gift!

Entries.DialogueText: I just got off the phone with the Governor... Apparently this rain is supposed to be completely harmless. Just an unusual phenomenon of nature.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I just got off the phone with the Governor... Apparently this rain is supposed to be completely harmless. Just an unusual phenomenon of nature.

Entries.DialogueText: Still, some of the townsfolk are panicking, which is never good...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Still, some of the townsfolk are panicking, which is never good...

Entries.DialogueText: Well, that was quite the excitement for our little town! I'm just relieved that everyone is okay. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, that was quite the excitement for our little town! I'm just relieved that everyone is okay.

Entries.DialogueText: If this ever happens again, I think we'll all be a little more relaxed. It's not the end of the world!
Entries.DisplayPattern: If this ever happens again, I think we'll all be a little more relaxed. It's not the end of the world!

Entries.DialogueText: I guess we can expect these unusual rains every year. I think everyone is a little calmer knowing that it's just part of nature.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I guess we can expect these unusual rains every year. I think everyone is a little calmer knowing that it's just part of nature.

Entries.DialogueText: Ah, you remembered the old mayor's birthday... what's this? {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ah, you remembered the old mayor's birthday... what's this?

Entries.DialogueText: Um... well you know what they say, 'it's the thought that counts'.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Um... well you know what they say, 'it's the thought that counts'.

Entries.DialogueText: Hey, I was doing my nightly rounds, and noticed that your first parsnip was ready. Congratulations!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hey, I was doing my nightly rounds, and noticed that your first parsnip was ready. Congratulations!

Entries.DialogueText: Those melons have been looking real good over at %farm farm! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Those melons have been looking real good over at farm!

Entries.DialogueText: You know, that was one of your grandpa's favorite crops back in the day.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You know, that was one of your grandpa's favorite crops back in the day.

Entries.DialogueText: Nothing says 'Fall' quite like a pumpkin, don't you think?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Nothing says 'Fall' quite like a pumpkin, don't you think?

Entries.DialogueText: I'm impressed, {Farmer_Name}. You've really fixed up the place! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm impressed, . You've really fixed up the place!

Entries.DialogueText: Congratulations, {Farmer_Name}. This is a big step forward for you and %spouse. You've really grown some roots in this town!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Congratulations, . This is a big step forward for you and . You've really grown some roots in this town!

Entries.DialogueText: Congratulations once again, {Farmer_Name}.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Congratulations once again, .

Entries.DialogueText: The divorce paperwork is all squared away. Sorry that things didn't work out...
Entries.DisplayPattern: The divorce paperwork is all squared away. Sorry that things didn't work out...

Entries.DialogueText: Another divorce? C'mon, {Farmer_Name}... you should be a little more careful who you decide to marry in the future... {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Another divorce? C'mon, ... you should be a little more careful who you decide to marry in the future...

Entries.DialogueText: All the young people seem happy about the new movie theater.
Entries.DisplayPattern: All the young people seem happy about the new movie theater.

Entries.DialogueText: A thriving theater will be good for the local economy. I just hope there's nothing objectionable in those modern pictures!
Entries.DisplayPattern: A thriving theater will be good for the local economy. I just hope there's nothing objectionable in those modern pictures!

Entries.DialogueText: Everyone aboard! We're heading back to the valley!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Everyone aboard! We're heading back to the valley!

Entries.DialogueText: Vacation opportunities like this could really expand the local economy!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Vacation opportunities like this could really expand the local economy!

Entries.DialogueText: I'd better not stay in the sun too long, or my moustache will dry out.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'd better not stay in the sun too long, or my moustache will dry out.

Entries.DialogueText: Hehe... look at this place! I don't know how you did it, but this little vacation spot is the talk of the town. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hehe... look at this place! I don't know how you did it, but this little vacation spot is the talk of the town.

Entries.DialogueText: Hehe... Gus is really in his element.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hehe... Gus is really in his element.

Entries.DialogueText: {Farmer_Name}, I heard what you did for Pam and Penny... now *that's* the kind of community support I love to see in Pelican Town! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: , I heard what you did for Pam and Penny... now *that's* the kind of community support I love to see in Pelican Town!

Entries.DialogueText: {Farmer_Name}, did you hear? Someone paid Robin to build Pam and Penny a house! Robin won't tell me who it was, though.
Entries.DisplayPattern: , did you hear? Someone paid Robin to build Pam and Penny a house! Robin won't tell me who it was, though.

Entries.DialogueText: Regardless of who paid, I love seeing this kind of community support in Pelican Town! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Regardless of who paid, I love seeing this kind of community support in Pelican Town!

Entries.DialogueText: *sniff*... *sniff*... can you smell that? I've been catching hints of fresh crab all day... {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: *sniff*... *sniff*... can you smell that? I've been catching hints of fresh crab all day...

Entries.DialogueText: *sniff*... *sniff*... Ah, I sense you've been spending some time in the old Community Center. It's good to know someone's taking care of the place.
Entries.DisplayPattern: *sniff*... *sniff*... Ah, I sense you've been spending some time in the old Community Center. It's good to know someone's taking care of the place.

Entries.DialogueText: I've never felt such an overwhelming pride in our community. You've done Pelican Town a great service, {Farmer_Name}. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've never felt such an overwhelming pride in our community. You've done Pelican Town a great service, .

Entries.DialogueText: Somehow, that old bridge to the quarry is now repaired.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Somehow, that old bridge to the quarry is now repaired.

Entries.DialogueText: I'm shocked... It must've taken a whole team to fix that thing!
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm shocked... It must've taken a whole team to fix that thing!

Entries.DialogueText: Who could've done that?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Who could've done that?

Entries.DialogueText: {Farmer_Name}, did you hear? It seems the old town bus started working again overnight! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: , did you hear? It seems the old town bus started working again overnight!

Entries.DialogueText: That old thing has been dormant for decades... This is truly a great mystery.
Entries.DisplayPattern: That old thing has been dormant for decades... This is truly a great mystery.

Entries.DialogueText: So, the old Community Center is gone... I guess times change, and good things come and go... Yet I can't help but feel a sense of loss. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: So, the old Community Center is gone... I guess times change, and good things come and go... Yet I can't help but feel a sense of loss.

Entries.DialogueText: I just hope this doesn't mar my record as Mayor. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I just hope this doesn't mar my record as Mayor.

Entries.DialogueText: Congrats on winning that grange display competition.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Congrats on winning that grange display competition.

Entries.DialogueText: Hehe... Just between you and me, I think Pierre needed a bowl of humble pudding! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hehe... Just between you and me, I think Pierre needed a bowl of humble pudding!

Entries.DialogueText: It's a good season to start thinking about gardening, even for us non-farmers.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's a good season to start thinking about gardening, even for us non-farmers.

Entries.DialogueText: The valley is known for producing some of the finest spring flowers! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: The valley is known for producing some of the finest spring flowers!

Entries.DialogueText: Just place anything you want to sell in the shipping box next to your house.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Just place anything you want to sell in the shipping box next to your house.

Entries.DialogueText: I'll be interested in seeing what kinds of things you put in there.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'll be interested in seeing what kinds of things you put in there.

Entries.DialogueText: Hi, Gus!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hi, Gus!

Entries.DialogueText: At the start of each season you'll have to remove the previous season's dead crops. It's easiest with a scythe.
Entries.DisplayPattern: At the start of each season you'll have to remove the previous season's dead crops. It's easiest with a scythe.

Entries.DialogueText: Have you planted any spring crops yet? The season doesn't last forever, you know.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Have you planted any spring crops yet? The season doesn't last forever, you know.

Entries.DialogueText: You're in town early, huh? Finished with your farm chores already?
Entries.DisplayPattern: You're in town early, huh? Finished with your farm chores already?

Entries.DialogueText: $e
Entries.DisplayPattern: $e

Entries.DialogueText: Good morning! I'm just checking on the garden as usual. {Portrait:Happy}Hmm... are these aphids? {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good morning! I'm just checking on the garden as usual.Hmm... are these aphids?

Entries.DialogueText: $e
Entries.DisplayPattern: $e

Entries.DialogueText: Good morning! I'm just checking on the garden as usual. {Portrait:Happy}$e
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good morning! I'm just checking on the garden as usual.$e

Entries.DialogueText: Hmm... I hope these aren't scale bugs... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmm... I hope these aren't scale bugs...

Entries.DialogueText: Hmm... tax collection... *mumble* ...spring festivities expenses... *mumble*... {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmm... tax collection... *mumble* ...spring festivities expenses... *mumble*...

Entries.DialogueText: Yes?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Yes?

Entries.DialogueText: Ah... There's nothing like a strong cup of tea in the morning.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ah... There's nothing like a strong cup of tea in the morning.

Entries.DialogueText: The saloon can get pretty lively at night. Sometimes we even put a coin in the jukebox *chuckle* {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: The saloon can get pretty lively at night. Sometimes we even put a coin in the jukebox *chuckle*

Entries.DialogueText: I like to visit once a week or so to catch up on things, anyway.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I like to visit once a week or so to catch up on things, anyway.

Entries.DialogueText: Good evening! It's nice to see you socializing with the townsfolk.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good evening! It's nice to see you socializing with the townsfolk.

Entries.DialogueText: It's good to stop by once in a while and see what the latest news is. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's good to stop by once in a while and see what the latest news is.

Entries.DialogueText: Good evening, {Farmer_Name}! I'm glad to see you relaxing at the saloon. It's good for you to take a break now and then. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good evening, ! I'm glad to see you relaxing at the saloon. It's good for you to take a break now and then.

Entries.DialogueText: Your grandfather always worked himself too hard... I'll have an extra beer in his honor tonight.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Your grandfather always worked himself too hard... I'll have an extra beer in his honor tonight.

Entries.DialogueText: I hope things are going well on %farm farm. I'd hate to see it all dried up.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I hope things are going well on farm. I'd hate to see it all dried up.

Entries.DialogueText: Everyone seems a little happier on the weekends, don't you think?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Everyone seems a little happier on the weekends, don't you think?

Entries.DialogueText: I'm on the job seven days a week, though.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm on the job seven days a week, though.

Entries.DialogueText: I've been Mayor of Pelican Town for over twenty years!
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've been Mayor of Pelican Town for over twenty years!

Entries.DialogueText: No one ever runs against me when it's time for an election. I like to think that it means I'm doing my job well.
Entries.DisplayPattern: No one ever runs against me when it's time for an election. I like to think that it means I'm doing my job well.

Entries.DialogueText: I like being Mayor.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I like being Mayor.

Entries.DialogueText: Thank you {Farmer_Name}. I won't forget this.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Thank you . I won't forget this.

Entries.DialogueText: *sob* ... I can't believe you would do that... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: *sob* ... I can't believe you would do that...

Entries.DialogueText: You're terrible. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You're terrible.

Entries.DialogueText: Gardening is a hobby of mine, so I'm excited for this warm weather.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Gardening is a hobby of mine, so I'm excited for this warm weather.

Entries.DialogueText: Ah, my flowers are growing wonderfully! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ah, my flowers are growing wonderfully!

Entries.DialogueText: Good morning! Can you smell the sweet scent of these dew-lilies?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good morning! Can you smell the sweet scent of these dew-lilies?

Entries.DialogueText: $e
Entries.DisplayPattern: $e

Entries.DialogueText: It's early but the air is already quite warm. Summer is nice for an old guy like me hehe.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's early but the air is already quite warm. Summer is nice for an old guy like me hehe.

Entries.DialogueText: How did I become Mayor in the first place? It's a long story.
Entries.DisplayPattern: How did I become Mayor in the first place? It's a long story.

Entries.DialogueText: We're both too busy for stories right now.
Entries.DisplayPattern: We're both too busy for stories right now.

Entries.DialogueText: The moonlight jellies will be here soon. It's one of my favorite things about the valley.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The moonlight jellies will be here soon. It's one of my favorite things about the valley.

Entries.DialogueText: The saloon gets pretty lively at night.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The saloon gets pretty lively at night.

Entries.DialogueText: I like to visit once a week or so to catch up on things. And to get a taste of Gus' authentic spaghetti.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I like to visit once a week or so to catch up on things. And to get a taste of Gus' authentic spaghetti.

Entries.DialogueText: Hmm... I wonder if it's anyone's birthday today? I'd better check the calendar by Pierre's shop.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmm... I wonder if it's anyone's birthday today? I'd better check the calendar by Pierre's shop.

Entries.DialogueText: Everyone seems a little happier on the weekends, don't you think?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Everyone seems a little happier on the weekends, don't you think?

Entries.DialogueText: I'm on the job seven days a week, though.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm on the job seven days a week, though.

Entries.DialogueText: Say, are you growing any blueberries on your farm?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Say, are you growing any blueberries on your farm?

Entries.DialogueText: I do enjoy a fresh blueberry.%revealtaste:Lewis:258
Entries.DisplayPattern: I do enjoy a fresh blueberry.%revealtaste:Lewis:258

Entries.DialogueText: Some of the townsfolk are wary of strangers. You'll have to win their trust before they open up to you.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Some of the townsfolk are wary of strangers. You'll have to win their trust before they open up to you.

Entries.DialogueText: Just be persistent and you'll get through to them. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Just be persistent and you'll get through to them.

Entries.DialogueText: It was around this time of year when I first became Mayor, over twenty years ago.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It was around this time of year when I first became Mayor, over twenty years ago.

Entries.DialogueText: That makes me feel really old. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: That makes me feel really old.

Entries.DialogueText: If you have any suggestions for the town, just drop a note into my suggestion box.
Entries.DisplayPattern: If you have any suggestions for the town, just drop a note into my suggestion box.

Entries.DialogueText: Oh, that's right... I don't have a suggestion box.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh, that's right... I don't have a suggestion box.

Entries.DialogueText: Every Wednesday I have buckwheat waffles and coffee for breakfast. It's a little tradition I observe to keep the bachelor life interesting. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Every Wednesday I have buckwheat waffles and coffee for breakfast. It's a little tradition I observe to keep the bachelor life interesting.

Entries.DialogueText: Hmmm... these strange little mushrooms have been popping up in my wood chips. I wonder what kind they are?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmmm... these strange little mushrooms have been popping up in my wood chips. I wonder what kind they are?

Entries.DialogueText: Good morning! We're slowly entering the cold months, so I'm seeing my garden to a gentle end.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good morning! We're slowly entering the cold months, so I'm seeing my garden to a gentle end.

Entries.DialogueText: $e
Entries.DisplayPattern: $e

Entries.DialogueText: Ah, you're in town early, huh? Finished with your farm chores already?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ah, you're in town early, huh? Finished with your farm chores already?

Entries.DialogueText: The saloon gets pretty lively at night.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The saloon gets pretty lively at night.

Entries.DialogueText: I like to visit once a week or so to catch up on things.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I like to visit once a week or so to catch up on things.

Entries.DialogueText: I hope things are going well for you on the farm.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I hope things are going well for you on the farm.

Entries.DialogueText: Do you have any bee houses on your farm?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Do you have any bee houses on your farm?

Entries.DialogueText: If you place them near flowers you can get different types of honey.
Entries.DisplayPattern: If you place them near flowers you can get different types of honey.

Entries.DialogueText: Sometimes you can tell if there's something buried underground. Just keep your eyes open.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Sometimes you can tell if there's something buried underground. Just keep your eyes open.

Entries.DialogueText: Have you tried Gus' 'secret' spaghetti sauce? {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Have you tried Gus' 'secret' spaghetti sauce?

Entries.DialogueText: ...The ingredients may be secret, but the smell isn't.
Entries.DisplayPattern: ...The ingredients may be secret, but the smell isn't.

Entries.DialogueText: I'll see you later.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'll see you later.

Entries.DialogueText: Are you doing your best on the farm, {Farmer_Name}? You'll have to accomplish things in many areas if you want to become a well-rounded citizen.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Are you doing your best on the farm, ? You'll have to accomplish things in many areas if you want to become a well-rounded citizen.

Entries.DialogueText: Well, winter is here! That means the townspeople will be spending most of their days indoors.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, winter is here! That means the townspeople will be spending most of their days indoors.

Entries.DialogueText: At least you'll know where to find them! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: At least you'll know where to find them!

Entries.DialogueText: Another year is almost over!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Another year is almost over!

Entries.DialogueText: I hope you had a productive year!
Entries.DisplayPattern: I hope you had a productive year!

Entries.DialogueText: I've got to start coming up with a plan for improving our town next year!
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've got to start coming up with a plan for improving our town next year!

Entries.DialogueText: I'll still come by every night to collect your produce, even in the snow.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'll still come by every night to collect your produce, even in the snow.

Entries.DialogueText: You still need to make money in the winter!
Entries.DisplayPattern: You still need to make money in the winter!

Entries.DialogueText: I hope things are going well for you on the farm.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I hope things are going well for you on the farm.

Entries.DialogueText: I've never been married. I have no family. All I live for is to be Mayor. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've never been married. I have no family. All I live for is to be Mayor.

Entries.DialogueText: Is it worth it? {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Is it worth it?

Entries.DialogueText: ...*sigh*... {Portrait:Sad}
Hi there, {Farmer_Name}! How're you doing today? {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hi there, ! How're you doing today?

Entries.DialogueText: If you see Marnie, tell her I say 'hi'.
Entries.DisplayPattern: If you see Marnie, tell her I say 'hi'.

Entries.DialogueText: Hi there, {Farmer_Name}. Taking a break?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hi there, . Taking a break?

Entries.DialogueText: I hope the river doesn't overflow... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I hope the river doesn't overflow...

Entries.DialogueText: Hey! What do you think you're doing? That's private property! {Portrait:Love}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hey! What do you think you're doing? That's private property!

Entries.DialogueText: Sam!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Sam!

Entries.DialogueText: *sigh*... The youth these days... Sometimes I wonder if this town isn't doomed. {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: *sigh*... The youth these days... Sometimes I wonder if this town isn't doomed.

Entries.DialogueText: You saw what happened, {Farmer_Name}. What do you have to say about this?
Entries.DisplayPattern: You saw what happened, . What do you have to say about this?

Entries.DialogueText: You're right, sir. Sam should respect private property.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You're right, sir. Sam should respect private property.

Entries.DialogueText: Don't blame Sam. There's nowhere else for him to ride!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Don't blame Sam. There's nowhere else for him to ride!

Entries.DialogueText: I'm staying out of this.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm staying out of this.

Entries.DialogueText: Fine! I just won't ride my skateboard ever again. Happy? {Portrait:Angry}~Exactly! If there was a park in town, I could ride there and everyone would be happy.~Hmmph. Alright. {Portrait:Angry}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Fine! I just won't ride my skateboard ever again. Happy?~Exactly! If there was a park in town, I could ride there and everyone would be happy.~Hmmph. Alright.

Entries.DialogueText: You're being difficult, Sam. I have no problem with you riding around town, just try not to cause any damage! It's that simple.~Hmmph. I thought you were more mature than this, {Farmer_Name}. {Portrait:Love}~I'll let it slide this time, Sam. But I don't want to see you doing this anymore.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You're being difficult, Sam. I have no problem with you riding around town, just try not to cause any damage! It's that simple.~Hmmph. I thought you were more mature than this, .~I'll let it slide this time, Sam. But I don't want to see you doing this anymore.

Entries.DialogueText: Got it?~Sam... I'm sorry I yelled at you. Just please try not to damage anything in the future. Got it?~Got it?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Got it?~Sam... I'm sorry I yelled at you. Just please try not to damage anything in the future. Got it?~Got it?

Entries.DialogueText: I'm proud of you, Leah! Events like this really breathe life into our little town! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm proud of you, Leah! Events like this really breathe life into our little town!

Entries.DialogueText: Now let's start the bidding on these wonderful art pieces... A marvelous addition to your home! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now let's start the bidding on these wonderful art pieces... A marvelous addition to your home!

Entries.DialogueText: Do I hear 5000g for the pink one?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Do I hear 5000g for the pink one?

Entries.DialogueText: Wow! I'm exhausted.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Wow! I'm exhausted.

Entries.DialogueText: My show was a real success, wasn't it? {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: My show was a real success, wasn't it?

Entries.DialogueText: Marnie... we can't. If word got out, it could undermine my position of authority in the town! {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Marnie... we can't. If word got out, it could undermine my position of authority in the town!

Entries.DialogueText: You understand... don't you? {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You understand... don't you?

Entries.DialogueText: {Farmer_Name}...You overheard everything, didn't you? {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: ...You overheard everything, didn't you?

Entries.DialogueText: Yes... but I'll keep it a secret.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Yes... but I'll keep it a secret.

Entries.DialogueText: Yes... and I'm going to tell everyone.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Yes... and I'm going to tell everyone.

Entries.DialogueText: Oh, hi there.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh, hi there.

Entries.DialogueText: What an eyesore... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: What an eyesore...

Entries.DialogueText: This is the Pelican Town Community Center... or what's left of it, anyway. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: This is the Pelican Town Community Center... or what's left of it, anyway.

Entries.DialogueText: It used to be the pride and joy of the town... always bustling with activity.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It used to be the pride and joy of the town... always bustling with activity.

Entries.DialogueText: Now... just look at it. It's shameful. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now... just look at it. It's shameful.

Entries.DialogueText: These days, the young folk would rather sit in front of the TV than engage with the community.
Entries.DisplayPattern: These days, the young folk would rather sit in front of the TV than engage with the community.

Entries.DialogueText: But listen to me, I sound like an old fool. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: But listen to me, I sound like an old fool.

Entries.DialogueText: Joja Corporation has been hounding me to sell them the land so they can turn it into a warehouse...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Joja Corporation has been hounding me to sell them the land so they can turn it into a warehouse...

Entries.DialogueText: Pelican Town could use the money, but there's something stopping me from selling it... I guess old timers like me get attached to relics of the past... Ah well. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Pelican Town could use the money, but there's something stopping me from selling it... I guess old timers like me get attached to relics of the past... Ah well.

Entries.DialogueText: If anyone else buys a Joja Co. Membership I'm just gonna go ahead and sell it.
Entries.DisplayPattern: If anyone else buys a Joja Co. Membership I'm just gonna go ahead and sell it.

Entries.DialogueText: *sigh*... Here, let's go inside...
Entries.DisplayPattern: *sigh*... Here, let's go inside...

Entries.DialogueText: Hmm? What's this?...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmm? What's this?...

Entries.DialogueText: I guess Vincent and Jas must've been playing in here.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I guess Vincent and Jas must've been playing in here.

Entries.DialogueText: This place is even more dilapidated than I remember.
Entries.DisplayPattern: This place is even more dilapidated than I remember.

Entries.DialogueText: What?
Entries.DisplayPattern: What?

Entries.DialogueText: What's the matter? Are you ill? {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: What's the matter? Are you ill?

Entries.DialogueText: You saw something? Hmm... I wouldn't be surprised if this place was full of rats. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You saw something? Hmm... I wouldn't be surprised if this place was full of rats.

Entries.DialogueText: You're worrying me, {Farmer_Name}... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You're worrying me, ...

Entries.DialogueText: Look, I think I'm going to head home. I need some lunch.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Look, I think I'm going to head home. I need some lunch.

Entries.DialogueText: Hey. I'll keep this place unlocked from now on... maybe you can help catch that rat if you have some extra time.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hey. I'll keep this place unlocked from now on... maybe you can help catch that rat if you have some extra time.

Entries.DialogueText: Strange...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Strange...

Entries.DialogueText: I'll have to come back and explore this building further.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'll have to come back and explore this building further.

Entries.DialogueText: I'm not sure how you did it, {Farmer_Name}... but the community center has never looked better! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm not sure how you did it, ... but the community center has never looked better!

Entries.DialogueText: You've done Pelican Town a great service. Everyone in town is pleased. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You've done Pelican Town a great service. Everyone in town is pleased.

Entries.DialogueText: As a way of saying 'Thank You', I'd like to present you with this Town's greatest honor... The Stardew Hero Award. You've earned it! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: As a way of saying 'Thank You', I'd like to present you with this Town's greatest honor... The Stardew Hero Award. You've earned it!

Entries.DialogueText: VOICE: Grumble... Grumble...
Entries.DisplayPattern: VOICE: Grumble... Grumble...

Entries.DialogueText: Who's that?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Who's that?

Entries.DialogueText: Ah, Morris.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ah, Morris.

Entries.DialogueText: Ah, hello there, {Farmer_Name}. You showed up at the perfect time. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ah, hello there, . You showed up at the perfect time.

Entries.DialogueText: It's our new 'Special Orders' board.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's our new 'Special Orders' board.

Entries.DialogueText: Robin and I built it from scratch. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Robin and I built it from scratch.

Entries.DialogueText: *Ahem*... Ignore her. {Portrait:Angry}
Entries.DisplayPattern: *Ahem*... Ignore her.

Entries.DialogueText: Now, let me explain...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now, let me explain...

Entries.DialogueText: You see... with %farm Farm back in business, the local economy has really been picking up.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You see... with Farm back in business, the local economy has really been picking up.

Entries.DialogueText: As a result, some of the local townsfolk have been asking me for a way to source local ingredients for their businesses or personal projects.
Entries.DisplayPattern: As a result, some of the local townsfolk have been asking me for a way to source local ingredients for their businesses or personal projects.

Entries.DialogueText: So, Robin and I came up with the idea of a new 'Special Orders' board, where people can post bigger jobs than would make sense for the old billboard outside Pierre's.
Entries.DisplayPattern: So, Robin and I came up with the idea of a new 'Special Orders' board, where people can post bigger jobs than would make sense for the old billboard outside Pierre's.

Entries.DialogueText: I thought so! I wouldn't expect anything less from you, {Farmer_Name}.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I thought so! I wouldn't expect anything less from you, .

Entries.DialogueText: *groan*
Entries.DisplayPattern: *groan*

Entries.DialogueText: Well, I'm sure you're busy, so we won't keep you away from your work any longer.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, I'm sure you're busy, so we won't keep you away from your work any longer.

Entries.DialogueText: As always, I appreciate your willingness to contribute! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: As always, I appreciate your willingness to contribute!

Entries.DialogueText: Take care, {Farmer_Name}.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Take care, .

Entries.DialogueText: Huh... I wouldn't expect such a tepid response from you, {Farmer_Name}. I'm disappointed. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Huh... I wouldn't expect such a tepid response from you, . I'm disappointed.

Entries.DialogueText: Hmmph... Well, we're done here, Robin. {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmmph... Well, we're done here, Robin.

Entries.DialogueText: ...Wouldn't want to waste any more of {Farmer_Name}'s precious 'me' time. {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: ...Wouldn't want to waste any more of 's precious 'me' time.

Entries.DialogueText: Oh my!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh my!

Entries.DialogueText: Why not...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Why not...

Entries.DialogueText: Ah, hello there, {Farmer_Name}.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ah, hello there, .

Entries.DialogueText: I was just loading some more prizes into this machine here...
Entries.DisplayPattern: I was just loading some more prizes into this machine here...

Entries.DialogueText: It's a new program I've come up with, to help promote a spirit of goodwill among the townsfolk... You included!
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's a new program I've come up with, to help promote a spirit of goodwill among the townsfolk... You included!

Entries.DialogueText: It's pretty simple... sometimes, when you help out others in town, you'll receive a 'Prize Ticket'. You can turn them in for rewards.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's pretty simple... sometimes, when you help out others in town, you'll receive a 'Prize Ticket'. You can turn them in for rewards.

Entries.DialogueText: There's some special stuff in there! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: There's some special stuff in there!

Entries.DialogueText: My only worry is that people will just go after the tickets, rather than cultivating a true compassion for their fellow man... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: My only worry is that people will just go after the tickets, rather than cultivating a true compassion for their fellow man...

Entries.DialogueText: Is that so? Well, I'm glad to hear that! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Is that so? Well, I'm glad to hear that!

Entries.DialogueText: I see! {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I see!

Entries.DialogueText: Well... that's not what I hoped to hear, but I appreciate the honesty.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well... that's not what I hoped to hear, but I appreciate the honesty.

Entries.DialogueText: At any rate... keep checking the 'Help Wanted' board in town. That's a good way to get your hands on more tickets.
Entries.DisplayPattern: At any rate... keep checking the 'Help Wanted' board in town. That's a good way to get your hands on more tickets.

Entries.DialogueText: Good luck out there.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good luck out there.

Entries.DialogueText: Mmph..
Entries.DisplayPattern: Mmph..

Entries.DialogueText: Ah, the new farmer! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ah, the new farmer!

Entries.DialogueText: Welcome! I'm Lewis, Mayor of Pelican Town.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Welcome! I'm Lewis, Mayor of Pelican Town.

Entries.DialogueText: You know, everyone's been asking about you.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You know, everyone's been asking about you.

Entries.DialogueText: It's not every day that someone new moves in. It's quite a big deal!
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's not every day that someone new moves in. It's quite a big deal!

Entries.DialogueText: So... You're moving into your grandfather's old cottage.
Entries.DisplayPattern: So... You're moving into your grandfather's old cottage.

Entries.DialogueText: It's a good house... very 'rustic'.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's a good house... very 'rustic'.

Entries.DialogueText: Rude!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Rude!

Entries.DialogueText: Don't listen to her, {Farmer_Name}. She's just trying to make you dissatisfied so that you buy one of her house upgrades. {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Don't listen to her, . She's just trying to make you dissatisfied so that you buy one of her house upgrades.

Entries.DialogueText: Anyway... You must be tired from the long journey. You should get some rest.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Anyway... You must be tired from the long journey. You should get some rest.

Entries.DialogueText: Tomorrow you ought to explore the town a bit and introduce yourself.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Tomorrow you ought to explore the town a bit and introduce yourself.

Entries.DialogueText: The townspeople would appreciate that.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The townspeople would appreciate that.

Entries.DialogueText: Oh, I almost forgot. If you have anything to sell, just place it in this box here. I'll come by during the night to collect it.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh, I almost forgot. If you have anything to sell, just place it in this box here. I'll come by during the night to collect it.

Entries.DialogueText: Well... Good luck!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well... Good luck!

Entries.DialogueText: Well {Farmer_Name}, it's the big day... Our most important festival of the year, the 'Stardew Valley Fair'.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well , it's the big day... Our most important festival of the year, the 'Stardew Valley Fair'.

Entries.DialogueText: If you'd like to participate by setting up a grange display, I've left an empty stand for you. Just let me know after you've set everything up so we can get to the judging.
Entries.DisplayPattern: If you'd like to participate by setting up a grange display, I've left an empty stand for you. Just let me know after you've set everything up so we can get to the judging.

Entries.DialogueText: Greetings, {Farmer_Name}! The 'Stardew Valley Fair' is finally here and the crowd is growing by the minute.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Greetings, ! The 'Stardew Valley Fair' is finally here and the crowd is growing by the minute.

Entries.DialogueText: Just like last year, I've set up an empty grange display for you. Speak with me when you're ready to commence the judging.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Just like last year, I've set up an empty grange display for you. Speak with me when you're ready to commence the judging.

Entries.DialogueText: Good evening, {Farmer_Name}. Have you ventured into the haunted maze yet? It's quite spooky.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good evening, . Have you ventured into the haunted maze yet? It's quite spooky.

Entries.DialogueText: That strange man who lives in the tower set it all up himself. He wouldn't let anyone near while he was working on it.
Entries.DisplayPattern: That strange man who lives in the tower set it all up himself. He wouldn't let anyone near while he was working on it.

Entries.DialogueText: Good evening, {Farmer_Name}. Once again, we've been graced with a haunted maze, constructed in secret by the eccentric who lives out in the forest. {Portrait:Neutral}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good evening, . Once again, we've been graced with a haunted maze, constructed in secret by the eccentric who lives out in the forest.

Entries.DialogueText: I've heard it's larger this year. Good luck if you dare to venture inside...
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've heard it's larger this year. Good luck if you dare to venture inside...

Entries.DialogueText: Enjoying yourself, {Farmer_Name}? {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Enjoying yourself, ?

Entries.DialogueText: Wow, look at all these eggs! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Wow, look at all these eggs!

Entries.DialogueText: Now if only I could get you kids to pick up litter this efficiently, we'd have the cleanest town this side of the Gem Sea! *chuckle* {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now if only I could get you kids to pick up litter this efficiently, we'd have the cleanest town this side of the Gem Sea! *chuckle*

Entries.DialogueText: And now, the winner of this year's egg hunt...
Entries.DisplayPattern: And now, the winner of this year's egg hunt...

Entries.DialogueText: Here's your prize! Enjoy.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Here's your prize! Enjoy.

Entries.DialogueText: Well, that's it for this year's Egg Festival. Thanks for coming, everyone!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, that's it for this year's Egg Festival. Thanks for coming, everyone!

Entries.DialogueText: Here's your prize, Abigail. Enjoy!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Here's your prize, Abigail. Enjoy!

Entries.DialogueText: Well, that's it for this year's Egg Festival. Thanks for coming, everyone!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, that's it for this year's Egg Festival. Thanks for coming, everyone!

Entries.DialogueText: It's time for the highlight of today's festivities... The Annual Spring Egg Hunt! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's time for the highlight of today's festivities... The Annual Spring Egg Hunt!

Entries.DialogueText: Calm down now, kiddos. You're going to need all your energy if you hope to find the most eggs and take home the exclusive prize.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Calm down now, kiddos. You're going to need all your energy if you hope to find the most eggs and take home the exclusive prize.

Entries.DialogueText: Now... Is everyone ready?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now... Is everyone ready?

Entries.DialogueText: Let the egg hunt begin! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Let the egg hunt begin!

Entries.DialogueText: Wow, look at all these eggs! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Wow, look at all these eggs!

Entries.DialogueText: Now if only I could get you kids to pick up litter this efficiently, we'd have the cleanest town this side of the Gem Sea! *chuckle* {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now if only I could get you kids to pick up litter this efficiently, we'd have the cleanest town this side of the Gem Sea! *chuckle*

Entries.DialogueText: And now, the winner of this year's egg hunt...
Entries.DisplayPattern: And now, the winner of this year's egg hunt...

Entries.DialogueText: Here's your prize! Enjoy.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Here's your prize! Enjoy.

Entries.DialogueText: Well, that's it for this year's Egg Festival. Thanks for coming, everyone!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, that's it for this year's Egg Festival. Thanks for coming, everyone!

Entries.DialogueText: It's time for the highlight of today's festivities... The Annual Spring Egg Hunt! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's time for the highlight of today's festivities... The Annual Spring Egg Hunt!

Entries.DialogueText: Calm down now, kiddos. You're going to need all your energy if you hope to find the most eggs and take home the exclusive prize.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Calm down now, kiddos. You're going to need all your energy if you hope to find the most eggs and take home the exclusive prize.

Entries.DialogueText: Now... Is everyone ready?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now... Is everyone ready?

Entries.DialogueText: Let the egg hunt begin! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Let the egg hunt begin!

Entries.DialogueText: If you'd like to dance with the other young people, you'll need to find a partner.
Entries.DisplayPattern: If you'd like to dance with the other young people, you'll need to find a partner.

Entries.DialogueText: Good afternoon, {Farmer_Name}. The weather for today's festivities couldn't be more perfect. {Portrait:Neutral}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good afternoon, . The weather for today's festivities couldn't be more perfect.

Entries.DialogueText: Come talk to me when you're ready to start the ceremony. {Portrait:Neutral}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Come talk to me when you're ready to start the ceremony.

Entries.DialogueText: Look sharp! The governor's here for his annual visit.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Look sharp! The governor's here for his annual visit.

Entries.DialogueText: If you brought something for the potluck make sure and add it to the soup cauldron.
Entries.DisplayPattern: If you brought something for the potluck make sure and add it to the soup cauldron.

Entries.DialogueText: The governor is our distinguished guest today! I expect all of you to be on your best behavior.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The governor is our distinguished guest today! I expect all of you to be on your best behavior.

Entries.DialogueText: For those who brought something for the potluck, contribute your ingredients to the soup cauldron.
Entries.DisplayPattern: For those who brought something for the potluck, contribute your ingredients to the soup cauldron.

Entries.DialogueText: Well folks, it's time once again for the potluck ceremony.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well folks, it's time once again for the potluck ceremony.

Entries.DialogueText: I trust that you all put high-quality ingredients in the pot this year. We don't want the governor to regret his visit to the valley!
Entries.DisplayPattern: I trust that you all put high-quality ingredients in the pot this year. We don't want the governor to regret his visit to the valley!

Entries.DialogueText: Well... Governor? Would you do us the honor of tasting the soup?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well... Governor? Would you do us the honor of tasting the soup?

Entries.DialogueText: Whoever took part in this appalling act is truly reprehensible. Using my very private item for this sick purpose! {Portrait:Love}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Whoever took part in this appalling act is truly reprehensible. Using my very private item for this sick purpose!

Entries.DialogueText: And to ruin a perfectly good soup... unforgivable! I've never been more ashamed of this community... Truly disgusting. {Portrait:Love}
Entries.DisplayPattern: And to ruin a perfectly good soup... unforgivable! I've never been more ashamed of this community... Truly disgusting.

Entries.DialogueText: Go home, the festival is over. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Go home, the festival is over.

Entries.DialogueText: You're right... It's a little bland. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You're right... It's a little bland.

Entries.DialogueText: Well, thanks for joining us this year, Governor. Sorry the soup wasn't anything special.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, thanks for joining us this year, Governor. Sorry the soup wasn't anything special.

Entries.DialogueText: Now... who else wants some soup?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now... who else wants some soup?

Entries.DialogueText: You're right... It's delicious! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You're right... It's delicious!

Entries.DialogueText: Wonderful job, everyone! Now... who else wants a taste? {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Wonderful job, everyone! Now... who else wants a taste?

Entries.DialogueText: Mmm... tasty. You all did very well today.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Mmm... tasty. You all did very well today.

Entries.DialogueText: Now... who else wants some soup?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now... who else wants some soup?

Entries.DialogueText: He's right... It's nothing special. Not bad, though.
Entries.DisplayPattern: He's right... It's nothing special. Not bad, though.

Entries.DialogueText: Well... who else wants some soup?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well... who else wants some soup?

Entries.DialogueText: Yuck. Someone must have ruined it with a poor-quality ingredient. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Yuck. Someone must have ruined it with a poor-quality ingredient.

Entries.DialogueText: Well... does anyone want any?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well... does anyone want any?

Entries.DialogueText: Good going, people... Whoever put that foul ingredient in the soup made the Governor pass out! I'm ashamed. {Portrait:Love}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good going, people... Whoever put that foul ingredient in the soup made the Governor pass out! I'm ashamed.

Entries.DialogueText: Go home, the festival is over. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Go home, the festival is over.

Entries.DialogueText: Hello and welcome, everyone! I'm pleased to announce that the potluck ceremony has begun.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hello and welcome, everyone! I'm pleased to announce that the potluck ceremony has begun.

Entries.DialogueText: I have high hopes that you all contributed high-quality ingredients! We want to leave the governor with a good impression, now.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I have high hopes that you all contributed high-quality ingredients! We want to leave the governor with a good impression, now.

Entries.DialogueText: Well... Governor? Would you indulge us with an honorary first tasting?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well... Governor? Would you indulge us with an honorary first tasting?

Entries.DialogueText: Good evening, {Farmer_Name}. The Moonlight Jellies are close... I already saw one glowing in the distance.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good evening, . The Moonlight Jellies are close... I already saw one glowing in the distance.

Entries.DialogueText: Once we launch the candle-boat they'll come up to the docks and say hello.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Once we launch the candle-boat they'll come up to the docks and say hello.

Entries.DialogueText: Greetings, {Farmer_Name}. As the evening sets in, the Moonlight Jellies draw closer to the shoreline.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Greetings, . As the evening sets in, the Moonlight Jellies draw closer to the shoreline.

Entries.DialogueText: Once we set the candle-boat on its way, they'll gather around the docks. {Portrait:Neutral}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Once we set the candle-boat on its way, they'll gather around the docks.

Entries.DialogueText: Today is a time to be thankful for this year's good fortune. Forget your worries for a day and relax!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Today is a time to be thankful for this year's good fortune. Forget your worries for a day and relax!

Entries.DialogueText: Happy Feast Of The Winter Star, {Farmer_Name}. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Happy Feast Of The Winter Star, .

Entries.DialogueText: This is a time to unwind, enjoy good company, and express gratitude for all that we have. {Portrait:Neutral}
Entries.DisplayPattern: This is a time to unwind, enjoy good company, and express gratitude for all that we have.

Entries.DialogueText: Welcome to the Festival of Ice!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Welcome to the Festival of Ice!

Entries.DialogueText: The highlight of today's festival is the ice fishing competition. We set up this 'frozen lake' and stocked it full of fish.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The highlight of today's festival is the ice fishing competition. We set up this 'frozen lake' and stocked it full of fish.

Entries.DialogueText: Just let me know when you're ready to compete.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Just let me know when you're ready to compete.

Entries.DialogueText: Hello, {Farmer_Name}. It's that time of the year again for the ice fishing festival.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hello, . It's that time of the year again for the ice fishing festival.

Entries.DialogueText: Speak with me when you're ready to start the competition! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Speak with me when you're ready to start the competition!

Entries.DialogueText: Alright, everyone. Let's begin this year's ice fishing competition.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Alright, everyone. Let's begin this year's ice fishing competition.

Entries.DialogueText: Contestants, your goal is to catch as many fish as you possibly can in two minutes using the provided fishing rods.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Contestants, your goal is to catch as many fish as you possibly can in two minutes using the provided fishing rods.

Entries.DialogueText: You must catch your fish here, from these holes in the ice.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You must catch your fish here, from these holes in the ice.

Entries.DialogueText: Well, is everyone ready?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, is everyone ready?

Entries.DialogueText: Begin!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Begin!

Entries.DialogueText: Wow, that's a lot of fish! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Wow, that's a lot of fish!

Entries.DialogueText: *gag*... the smell... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: *gag*... the smell...

Entries.DialogueText: Now, for the winner of this year's ice fishing competition...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now, for the winner of this year's ice fishing competition...

Entries.DialogueText: Here's your prize! Enjoy.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Here's your prize! Enjoy.

Entries.DialogueText: Well, that's it for this year's Festival of Ice. Thanks for coming, everyone!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, that's it for this year's Festival of Ice. Thanks for coming, everyone!

Entries.DialogueText: Now let's release these poor fish... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now let's release these poor fish...

Entries.DialogueText: Here's your prize, Willy. Enjoy.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Here's your prize, Willy. Enjoy.

Entries.DialogueText: Well, that's it for this year's Festival of Ice. Thanks for coming, everyone!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, that's it for this year's Festival of Ice. Thanks for coming, everyone!

Entries.DialogueText: Now let's release these poor fish... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now let's release these poor fish...

Entries.DialogueText: Alright, everyone. Let's begin this year's ice fishing competition.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Alright, everyone. Let's begin this year's ice fishing competition.

Entries.DialogueText: Contestants, with the provided fishing rods you must catch as many fish as you can from these holes in the ice.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Contestants, with the provided fishing rods you must catch as many fish as you can from these holes in the ice.

Entries.DialogueText: Are you all ready?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Are you all ready?

Entries.DialogueText: Begin!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Begin!

Entries.DialogueText: Impressive, that's a lot of caught fish! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Impressive, that's a lot of caught fish!

Entries.DialogueText: *gag*... I will never get used to that stench... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: *gag*... I will never get used to that stench...

Entries.DialogueText: Now, for the winner of this year's ice fishing competition...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now, for the winner of this year's ice fishing competition...

Entries.DialogueText: Here's your prize! Enjoy.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Here's your prize! Enjoy.

Entries.DialogueText: Well, that's it for this year's Festival of Ice. Thanks for coming, everyone!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, that's it for this year's Festival of Ice. Thanks for coming, everyone!

Entries.DialogueText: Now let's release these poor fish... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now let's release these poor fish...

Entries.DialogueText: Here's your prize, Willy. Enjoy.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Here's your prize, Willy. Enjoy.

Entries.DialogueText: Well, that's it for this year's Festival of Ice. Thanks for coming, everyone!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, that's it for this year's Festival of Ice. Thanks for coming, everyone!

Entries.DialogueText: Now let's release these poor fish... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now let's release these poor fish...

Entries.DialogueText: Wow, this is my favorite! Thank you!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Wow, this is my favorite! Thank you!

Entries.DialogueText: Thanks, this is great!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Thanks, this is great!

Entries.DialogueText: Well, I guess it's the thought that counts...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, I guess it's the thought that counts...

Entries.DialogueText: This makes me sick. What a horrendous gift.
Entries.DisplayPattern: This makes me sick. What a horrendous gift.

Entries.DialogueText: That's very nice of you. Thanks.
Entries.DisplayPattern: That's very nice of you. Thanks.

Entries.DialogueText: Wow... Look at that view.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Wow... Look at that view.

Entries.DialogueText: You know, {Farmer_Name}... I've been mayor of Pelican Town for a long time.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You know, ... I've been mayor of Pelican Town for a long time.

Entries.DialogueText: People have come and gone. We've lived through times of hardship, and times of plenty.
Entries.DisplayPattern: People have come and gone. We've lived through times of hardship, and times of plenty.

Entries.DialogueText: But I have to say, in all the years I've been mayor, nothing has made me so proud as seeing %farm Farm blossom under your care. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: But I have to say, in all the years I've been mayor, nothing has made me so proud as seeing Farm blossom under your care.

Entries.DialogueText: You've taken the farm beyond the wildest dreams of your Grandfather.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You've taken the farm beyond the wildest dreams of your Grandfather.

Entries.DialogueText: And in the process, you've changed the valley forever.
Entries.DisplayPattern: And in the process, you've changed the valley forever.

Entries.DialogueText: You might not realize it, but I care a lot about this town, {Farmer_Name}.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You might not realize it, but I care a lot about this town, .

Entries.DialogueText: year years ago, I was deeply worried about the future of the valley. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: year years ago, I was deeply worried about the future of the valley.

Entries.DialogueText: But now, I feel completely at ease.
Entries.DisplayPattern: But now, I feel completely at ease.

Entries.DialogueText: Who knew a humble farmer moving to town would change everything? {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Who knew a humble farmer moving to town would change everything?

Entries.DialogueText: ...Thank you.
Entries.DisplayPattern: ...Thank you.

Entries.DialogueText: I watched cowboy movies when I was a kid... I'm glad to see the art is still alive!
Entries.DisplayPattern: I watched cowboy movies when I was a kid... I'm glad to see the art is still alive!

Entries.DialogueText: (I wonder what kind of moustache wax he uses?)
Entries.DisplayPattern: (I wonder what kind of moustache wax he uses?)

Entries.DialogueText: Mayor Lewis seems deep in thought...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Mayor Lewis seems deep in thought...

Entries.DialogueText: Heh, that was great! Really brought me back... {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Heh, that was great! Really brought me back...

Entries.DialogueText: The governor himself recommended this movie to me!
Entries.DisplayPattern: The governor himself recommended this movie to me!

Entries.DialogueText: Fantastic! They really made Stardew Valley look beautiful, didn't they? If only they had featured Pelican Town itself... {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Fantastic! They really made Stardew Valley look beautiful, didn't they? If only they had featured Pelican Town itself...

Entries.DialogueText: As mayor, I need to know what kinds of movies are being shown in our community. We have the tender minds of the next generation to worry about!
Entries.DisplayPattern: As mayor, I need to know what kinds of movies are being shown in our community. We have the tender minds of the next generation to worry about!

Entries.DialogueText: Hah! That wasn't bad at all... I'd say this one's 'Mayor Approved'. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hah! That wasn't bad at all... I'd say this one's 'Mayor Approved'.

Entries.DialogueText: Hmm... I guess it will be interesting to see what the young people are watching these days...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmm... I guess it will be interesting to see what the young people are watching these days...

Entries.DialogueText: Huh... I wonder if the messages in this movie are good for our community?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Huh... I wonder if the messages in this movie are good for our community?

Entries.DialogueText: After a long, dark winter, this festival is a good way to revive everyone.
Entries.DisplayPattern: After a long, dark winter, this festival is a good way to revive everyone.

Entries.DialogueText: All of this is possible because you fixed the bus, {Farmer_Name}! I can't thank you enough.
Entries.DisplayPattern: All of this is possible because you fixed the bus, ! I can't thank you enough.

Entries.DialogueText: Remember, today is the last day of the festival. We'll be back next year, though.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Remember, today is the last day of the festival. We'll be back next year, though.

Entries.DialogueText: Good morning!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good morning!

Entries.DialogueText: Good afternoon.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good afternoon.

Entries.DialogueText: Good evening.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good evening.
